headline: Portobello Mushroom Burgers
description: This grilled portobello mushroom burger recipe is a winner. The provolone-topped 'shrooms are excellent in buns with lettuce, tomato, and aioli.

video.name: How to Make Portobello Mushroom Burgers

name: Portobello Mushroom Burgers

recipeInstructions.text: Place mushroom caps, smooth side up, in a shallow dish.
Whisk together balsamic, oil, garlic, basil, and oregano in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour vinaigrette over mushrooms. Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes or so, turning twice.
Brush grill grates with oil. Place mushrooms on grill, reserving marinade for basting. Grill until just tender, 5 to 8 minutes per side, brushing with marinade frequently.
Top mushrooms with cheese and continue grilling until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic!

I am trying to get more plant based in my diet. I'm to the point of eating meat maybe 2-3 times a week. I lead with that because I want the reader to understand that the point of view here is not a vegan. I am looking for recipes to fill those gaps where I would normally eat meat. So someone who is more removed from eating meat may enjoy this more. Also I followed the recipe (stop reviewing recipes after you change the recipe!!!) So there is no tips for changes. I found the texture of the mushroom very off putting on a sandwich. Keep in mind that the caps I used were stupidly huge. The marinade was ok but too vinegary for my taste. It kind of overwhelmed the flavor. I did make it with all the traditional toppings like tomato, onion, pickle, mustard, and light mayo. This gave it a "traditional" feel but it just wasn't enough to cover the mushroom. I'm still giving 4 stars because my opinion may differ from everyone else. Just be warned if you are use to eating big juicy hand made thick burgers, this will not be a replacement.
Great recipe!

It was absolutely delicious!!!!! I followed the recipe as follows, i forgot the dried basil, but I did use banana peppers as a topping it gave it such a boost of flavor and freshness! Highly recommend 10/10

I loved these! I marinated the mushrooms for about an hour (gills removed) and added a bit of liquid smoke to the mixture. I had mine on Romaine "buns" with regular toppings and grilled onions and peppers!
We love these!

We made these for dinner tonight. Didn’t marinade, just dipped the mushrooms and brushed the rest on while cooking. Better than any burger I’ve had lately!!! We ate them like steaks tonight, I think they deserve a nice crusty toasted bun to go with!!
Good but very watery. Try to get rid of as much water as possible.
Nice & crispy edges soft savory middle. My husband liked it, not usually a fan of non meat burgers no photo ALL GONE
This is a really delicious recipe. This was my first time cooking and eating portobello mushroom caps. I’m glad I used this recipe.
yes made it it was delish! read the comments were very helpfull
Excellent Flavor, I also cut up some bell peppers and zucchini for the grill brushed those with the vinaigrette mixture, and added some sautéed onions very delicious.
Served without bun. Was very flavorful. An excellent side dish!
Not always a big fan of

Just looking for something different as I've got a bad case of the Sheltering Blues. 

Changed things up a bit here. Marinated for but half the time cited in the recipe. Carmelized vidalia onion and topped off the burger with smoked applewood gouda. 

Also used some lobster claw meat which, after cleaning, dropped into drawn butter with fresh tarragon, which I then topped the burger with for an open face burger.

A bit more intensive, but worth the effort. Effort is always rewarded.
Delicious!!!
Delicious! This is one of my favorite recipes on the site, and that’s saying a lot. The reviewer who suggested adding caramelized onions was brilliant. I may never eat a hamburger again.

OH MY LORD! This recipe was super simple and so very delicious. I will definitely use it again and again. I used swiss cheese instead of provolone. My daughter was home late from work, so the mushrooms sat for over an hour in the marinade and I worried that would affect the taste. If anything, it improved it. She ate all the "leftovers" and requested I make it again soon!
This was delicious. Better than I ever expected. I followed the recipe as written and used Modena vinegar as suggested and it came out perfectly. I will definitely make this again.
I followed the review of another and marinated it for about 5 minutes. I grilled it about 5 minutes per side. I did add grilled onions. It was good. I would make it again.
Great flavour. Added liquid smoke to this recipe. I’d definitely make this again to substitute family grill night

Amazing! I didn't grill it because I was too lazy to get the grill out. I put it in the oven at high heat. I added cheese and bacon. ??. It was amazing. I think I had a PMBurger once or twice before, it was okay. This one was juicy and didn't taste like meat. It became it's own thing. I wouldn't call it a burger because it didn't have to imitate anything - It stood alone on it's own merit! I'm eating the left over for lunch.
Delicious! Made as directed and it was wonderful! Will be making this again soon!
Absolutely delicious! Used vegan cheddar from Violife. Perfect burgers- even non-vegans in the family loved them.
Very flavorful!! A bit messy but that is expected... I'm a meat lover and I did not miss the meat
Used more garlic and added some fermented chili flakes to the marinade. Excellent recipe.

We LOVE this recipe. We are constantly making these. We also do not use a grill but instead use either my griddle pan or fry pan. Either way, they are so delicious! We also like to add a slice of red onion to each. We forgot to melt the cheese this time but they were still just as tasty. What an amazing way to eat these portabellas!
Easy, fast, smells wonderful and even my 11 year old ate them!
I made this with a little twist! It was awesome!

Made this recipe for the family and they absolutely chowed down! Even my husband, who is a big meat eater, loved it! I didn’t grill them but, broiled them and them did come out so yummy. To me, it’s an inexpensive meal and I definitely will be incorporating more in my weekly meal planning!
This was delicious!

Loved these. My wife felt the vinegar was a little too much for mushroom flavor so will do more olive oil next time. Concerned that the garlic might be too much, so added just a little less, but barely tasted it (the minced garlic stays on top of the gills, so adding the cheese smoothed out the flavor). Grilled with gill side down first, then after turning, added blue cheese during last two minutes - very good.

first portabella sandwich ive ever had. i think the vinegar was over powering. ill make it again with much less vinegar. the mushroom was not cooked through. next time ill add broth and let it simmer away to insure the mushroom is cooked through. the taste was good though.
They marinade gave it the perfect amount of flavor.
Best Burger Ever!
Like another, I broiled them.....used a bag for marinating..yummy!
Will definitely make these again they were delicious!!
I made as directed with the exception of baking in oven instead of grilling. I baked in oven at 450 degrees for 20 minutes stem side up. They were delicious!!
I have never Been able to duplicate restaurant style Portabella burgers until I tried this recipe. Peeling the mushrooms and taking out the fins made all the difference thanks to another cooks tip.
Came out flavorful and really amazing. The flavor was just right and everyone at my bbq loved it. Vegans and meat eaters alike. Everyone was happy.
Super easy and quick dinner. Actually used some older mushrooms, but it still was great! I did remove the gills only because I had some mold growing on them.

I have made these several times we love them I use fresh basil and oregano in marinade also added a bit of liquid smoke and Worcestershire I have topped with provolone caramelized onions you can use pretty much what ever cheese you like we have used gouda also love them I have grilled outside and also in oven turn out perfect a little hint take a fork and poke them while grilling they won't be as soggy
Was so tasty and a change of pace.
I followed the recipe exactly. It was great. previously I would just grill the mushrooms with no marinade. This definitely kept them moist and more flavorful. Will make it again.
Perfect recipe as is. Made many times for my family. Everyone love it.
This really have a good taste its is nice and even though it doesn't taste like a burger to me the meat of the mushroom make you think it is a real burger. I like this burger and will make again.
I made it according to the recipe, it was ok, will probably experiment on other methods.
This was very delicious and a big hit at our household. The flavors blended together very nicely to make for a tasty, hearty burger.
I did not have a grill so I followed another review and broiled them. Turned out very good.
Absolutely delicious, I didn't even mind the fact that there was no meat in my burger!

This was so much better than i expected!! I have recently gone vegetarian and this was a perfect meal. I ended up doing a lettuce wrap instead of buns but if i do this again i will probably get buns. I also cooked the mushrooms in the oven and it was great! The balsamic vinegar was the perfect touch. It was a total hit!
Not grilling weather, so I broiled instead. These were excellent, I imagine grilling would just push them over the top!
I've useIve used this recipe several times, delicious. Our guests loved it, too.
They were amazing! My husband and I both thought they were very tasty. My husband got to grill without using meat! A great summer meal.
OK - the taste was good - how can I make this more savoury?

The best portobello mushroom burger ever. Be sure to peal off top of mushroom and remove the gills. Great with caramelized onions. Far better than a $30 hamburger at a restaurant and much heather for you.

I made this for me and my husband. He wasn't sure about it as he's a beef man, so he made beef burgers too. He stacked his with the beef and enjoyed it. I had just the mushroom burger. I loved it. Made just as directed and assemble as I would a beef burger. I wouldn't change a thing. I would have this rather than beef.
I added 2TBSP of Worcestershire sauce and left it in Marinade a little longer. Definitely on my remake list of favorites.

Delicious! Didn’t change a thing. I would suggest for your thicker mushrooms to cook longer. Unfortunately that didn’t cross my mind until after we were eating, seeing as it wasn’t a meat patty. So the thickest mushroom wasn’t totally tender through. Delicious regardless! Wonderful marinade that perfectly complemented the mushroom!
The flavour was good and easy with things I had on hand. Even tasty heated up the next day (I Love leftovers)
Great everyone loved it a lot
Delicious!!!
Such a great tasting mushroom cap. Truly impressed.

I just made this for dinner! They're very juicy and can replace hamburgers SO easily! I did not taste the garlic at all (garlic fanatic), but the burger was so worth more! I have fallen in love with this recipe! What really caught my eyes is the calories, so I slimmed down the vinegar, oil, and spices. Still perfect though! I would recommend this and will definitely try again! I got more Portobella Mushrooms and ready! Frying pans work just as well! What to remember is that they SHRINK, which is upsetting. When I was first starting, I cut it in half, I didn't want them to shrink! Also, minutes way too long for the flat slide, that's where I stored the garlic. They started to burn, so-. All in all, five stars!
Delicious. Used cheddar because I had no provolone. Toppings were lettuce, tomato, red onion and garlic aioli. Will definitely make again.
Yum!
These were amazing. I have literally made them every week for a month now they are so flavorful and juicy.
So delicious! I can't stop making these
I did not make any changes and I have made it twice now! I will definitely make this anytime.
My wife loved it, which was a pleasant surprise, but even more telling was the fact that my 11 year old daughter did as well.
I'm not a vegetarian, but these can have a meaty texture if you cook them on the barbeque long enough. The provolone cheese is a nice touch.

Wow! What a burger. First I'll say, I love veggie burgers, restaurant, homemade, store bought, however, I always feel that something is missing. Enter this fantastic mushroom burger...it's the messiness and dripping!!!! I have had many portobello burgers before, but this one was the best. Great texture, taste and perfect amount of juiciness. 

I used a grill pan and a cover, it worded perfectly. I used cheddar as the cheese and followed another reviewer and grilled onion slices to go along with it. My mushroom caps were very large, so I split it in half for my daughter and myself. Now we have the other one for tonight! I will try to find smaller ones next time, though. 

Thank you for this fantastic recipe! I will make it quite often.
easy, delicious

I've been trying lots of different grilled portobello recipes recently, but this one has been the best one yet! I found that the amount of seasonings and balsamic vinegar was just right and gave it the perfect amount of flavor without being too strong. These were awesome!
Excellent, burgers. It was juicy I didn't need any ketchup
This recipe is simple and the Portabella burgers are the best tasting vegetarian burgers we've ever tasted. Even the meat eaters in the family were amazed just how tasty these burgers actually were
I threw on some artisanal cheddar, caramelized onions, and a grilled red pepper that had sat in the same marinade as the portobello. Delish.
These are perfect. The marinade is everything. Sometimes I add soy sauce or Worcestershire to the marinade to give it a little more kick, but it's not needed.
I didn't prepare it as a hamburger, just the mushrooms by themselves and I have to say they're great!! Definitely can replace the meat and that's coming from a meat lover.

I used my George Forman grill to do this... @300 for 8 minutes... opening every two minutes to put on the marinade... very good ... I used the STAR brand from Fred Meyer for the vinegar and I thought it tasted great .. I didn't use bread buns I used lettuce to wrap the mushroom up ... very good enjoyed doing this and I will for sure use this recipe again
i put less vinegar, and marined them less time, i was scared of the over vinegar flavor, and was so good!!
Love these mushroom burgers! We follow the recipe exactly and they taste just like the ones from restaurants. Great recipe, would highly recommend :)

I did this without cheese, and rather than do it standard, I simply prepared it like I was eating a regular hamburger, so I added sliced onion, roma tomato, lettuce, a touch of ketchup, and a bit of salad dressing (not mayonnaise).

This was my 1st time fixing these mushrooms, and found them surprisingly easy. Once that prep was done, everything else toòk no time.

Perhaps my ratios were off, but I just didn't like the marinade. The vinegar was too strong, and even the next day for lunch I was vomiting from the strong taste.

Otherwise, I loved it & plan to make it again.
Really good
The flavor was good. The mushrooms were flat and small.
I did not change the recipe..it was excellent! I find that Allrecipes is my "Go To recipe book" online because almost every recipe that I try is great. this one topped the cake.

Very tasty! I used sliced portobello mushrooms and they worked, but next time I will use the portobello mushroom caps as the recipe called for. We topped them with swiss cheese, tomato, spinach leaves, avocado slices, and grilled onions on a whole wheat bun. We will be making these again!
this was really good. Next time I will cook it a little longer, otherwise FANTASTIC.
I loved these so much!! I added a few drops of liquid smoke to the marianate to add some more of that burger flavor. I'm gonna make these more often now

It was good as written. I don't think my dish was shallow enough when marinating but they flavor was there. My first time having a portobello burger and as it was good, it is not the same texture as a regular burger though.
I will make this again! Made a few changes but it is a great recipe.

Better than a "real" hamburger! The flavor was outstanding. The mushroom, juicy. Used fresh herbs and broiled for 5 minutes on each side (along with some sliced red onion marinated in the same sauce). The only critique is on myself: don't make/assemble the burger until the last minute. The mushroom is so juicy that the burger will fall apart and need to be eaten with a fork and knife. Thanks for an excellent recipe!
Delicious! Left off the cheese because we are vegan. The closest thing to a traditional burger, only better! We brushed them with BBQ sauce and toasted the buns.
Amazing!

Holy moly this recipe is excellent! I used slightly less balsamic and a slightly more oil and subbed thyme for the basil. Cooked on a stovetop grill for about 5 min per side. Delish! Never need to buy a veggie burger again.

I've made this multiple times. I usually make it in the oven instead of on a grill (at about 450 degrees) and add goat cheese instead of the suggested cheese. It's absolutely delicious, although I do find that my burger ends up being a tiny bit watery from the marinade. I don't know if anyone else has found a solution to this. However, this is the best veggie burger recipe that I've found yet. I highly recommend it.
Loved this! Meat-eater husband was a fan so this is def going into my recipe book.

This turned out really well. Found some really nice, big caps. Err on the bigger side if possible. They're more forgiving. I'd also give it more marinating time than 15 minutes. An hour or more to really soak in the favors. Doubled the marinade to make sure there was left over for basting.
Great recipe. I used a smoked provolone, delicious!
